'''Kornelia Stoiber''' is a [[computer scientist]] from [[Austria]] who studied at a variety of universities and won a [https://ocg.at/fp-fh national IT incentive award]. In addition, she took courses in [[design]] and playing the [[clarinet]].<ref>{{Cite web
|title=Kornelia Stoiber on Beacons
|url=https://beacons.ai/kornelia.stoiber
|access-date=2024-10-05
|website=Beacons
|language=en
|url-status=live}}</ref>

'''Drafts:''' This user has created the [[Wikipedia]] drafts 
[[Draft:Wonderful Drinks]], [[Draft:Hummingbird Bike]], [[Draft:Ride Colibri]], [[Draft:Organifarms]],
[[Draft:Organic Batteries]] and 
[[Draft:Stalking Safety]].

'''Books:''' This user is currently looking forward to the publication of the book [[Patriot (book)|"Patriot: A Memoir"]] by [[Alexei Navalny]].

'''Videos:''' This user's favourite video is currently [https://youtube.com/watch?v=7aa_ik_UYTw "The 100,000 Qubit Quantum-Centric Supercomputer of 2033"] by [[IBM Research]].

'''Music:''' This user's favourite performance extracts are currently from the [[Concerto in F (Gershwin)| Gershwin Concerto in F]] [https://facebook.com/share/v/kHrnenbcALnmJwmb on Facebook] and [https://instagram.com/p/CXwNSXosiF_ on Instagram], performed by [[Yuja Wang]] and [[Michael Tilson Thomas]] together with the [[London Symphony Orchestra]].
